Basic Lesson 6 — {{Hebrew-Large|זֶה הַבַּיִת שֶׁלִי}}
Welcome to the sixth basic lesson of Hebrew! In this lesson we're going to learn the demonstrative and possessive pronouns, as well as basic syntax. ==Demonstrative Pronouns== Look at the following examples.
{{Hebrew| '''זֶה''' דוד.
'''זֹאת''' שרה.
'''אֵלֶּה''' שרה ודוד.
הבַּיִת ה'''זֶה'''.
אני בא מהעִיר ה'''זֹאת'''.
}}
The words highlighted are the '''demonstrative pronouns'''. In English the demonstrative pronouns are “this”, “that”, “these” and “those”. Here are the demonstrative pronouns in Hebrew: {| {{Hebrew table|Vocabulary|זֶה הַבַּיִת שֶׁלִי|Demonstratives|כִּינוּיֵי־זִיקָה|4}} ! ! Singular ! Plural |- | ''m'' | {{Hebrew|זֶה}} | rowspan = "2" | °{{Hebrew|אֵלֶּה}} |- | ''f'' | {{Hebrew|זֹאת}} |} '''Notes''' * The {{Hebrew|א}} in {{Hebrew|זֹאת}} is not pronounced. Usually, Hebrew makes no distinction between “this” and “that”. In English, when we want to demonstrate something, we add the demonstrative pronoun before it: “'''this''' house”, “'''that''' thing”, “I want '''these''' shoes”. In Hebrew, when there are demonstrations such as these, the pronoun is after the demonstrated object and both are definite. Too much information? Let's look at the examples. '''Examples''' * '''This street.''' The word for “street” is {{Hebrew|רְחוֹב}}, masculine, singular. We find the corresponding pronoun {{Hebrew|זֶה}} and add it after the {{Hebrew|רְחוֹב}}. Then, we add the definite article to both. : {{Hebrew|הרְחוֹב הזֶה.}} * '''Those houses.''' The word for “houses” is {{Hebrew|בָּתִים}}, masculine, plural (it is pluralized irregularly; the singular form is {{Hebrew|בַּיִת}}). : {{Hebrew|הבָּתִים האֵלֶּה.}} As for the other positions, we'll get to these in the third section of this lesson. ==Possessive Pronouns== Here are some more examples.
{{Hebrew| הבַּיִת '''שֶׁלִי'''.
העִיר '''שֶׁלָהֵם'''.
הרְחוֹבוֹת '''שֶׁלוֹ'''.
העָרִים '''שֶׁלָךְ'''. }}
The words highlighted are the '''possessive pronouns'''. In English the possessive pronouns are “my”, “your”, “his”, “her”, “its”, “our” and “their”. Here are the possessive pronouns in Hebrew: {| {{Hebrew table|Vocabulary|זֶה הַבַּיִת שֶׁלִי|Possessives|כִּינוּיֵי־הַקִּנְיָן|3}} ! ! Singular ! Plural |- | 1 | {{Hebrew|שֶׁלִי}} | {{Hebrew|שֶׁלָנוּ}} |- | 2 ''m'' | {{Hebrew|שֶׁלְךָ}} | {{Hebrew|שֶׁלָכֵם}} |- | 2 ''f'' | {{Hebrew|שֶׁלָךְ}} | {{Hebrew|שֶׁלָכֵן}}* |- | 3 ''m'' | {{Hebrew|שֶׁלוֹ}} | {{Hebrew|שֶׁלָהֵם}} |- | 3 ''f'' | {{Hebrew|שֶׁלָה}} | {{Hebrew|שֶׁלָהֵן}}* |} '''Notes''' * The plural feminine pronouns ({{Hebrew|שֶׁלָכֵן}} and {{Hebrew|שֶׁלָהֵן}}) are quickly falling out of use, particularly by young people, replaced by the masculine pronouns. When talking to/about a mixed group of people from both genders use {{Hebrew|שֶׁלָכֵם}} and {{Hebrew|שֶׁלָהֵם}}. In English, when we want to indicate that something belongs to someone, we add the correct possessive pronoun before it: “'''my''' house”, “'''his''' place”, “it's '''our''' world”. In Hebrew, we put that possessive pronoun after the object, and add the definite article '''only''' to the object. Let's look at the examples for clarification. '''Examples''' * '''Your (''m s.'') house.''' The correct equivalent possessive pronoun is {{Hebrew|שֶׁלְךָ}}. We put it after the word for “house” and add the definite article. : {{Hebrew|הבַּיִת שֶׁלְךָ.}} * '''Their (''f'') cities.''' The word for “cities” is {{Hebrew|עָרִים}} (despite its plural form, it is feminine. The singular is {{Hebrew|עִיר}}). : {{Hebrew|העָרִים שֶׁלָהֵן.}} ==Grammar: Syntax== Hebrew lacks the verb “to be” in the present tense. This includes its forms “am”, “are” and “is”. * The boy is playing. * I am bored. * They are pretty. * This is a book. It does, however, have alternatives: If what the object it is a noun, the verb “to be” is replaced by the personal pronoun in the 3rd person. This is not true for pronouns. If what the object it is an adjective, the verb “to be” is omitted and the definite article is added to the object. '''Examples''' * '''Jerusalem is a city.''' No indefinite articles in Hebrew (a) as well as the verb “to be” in the present tense. “City” is a noun. “Jerusalem” is feminine, singular — {{Hebrew|הִיא}}. : {{Hebrew|ירושלים היא עִיר.}} * '''The house is good.''' No verb “to be” in the present tense. “Good” is an adjective. : {{Hebrew|הבַּיִת טוב.}} * '''That is a street.''' No indefinite articles in Hebrew (a) as well as the verb “to be” in the present tense. “Street” is a noun, however, “that” is a pronoun. : {{Hebrew|זֶה רְחוֹב.}} ==Vocabulary== Transliterate and translate the following Hebrew expressions to English: {|width=100% style="background:#FFFFFF;" border="0" | colspan=3| |- | width=33% valign="top"| {{Question-answer | question = שלכם | answer = ''sheem''
Your (''m pl.'') }} {{Question-answer | question = עיר | answer = ''‘ir''
City }} {{Question-answer | question = שלך | answer = ''shelkha''/''shelakh''
Your (''sg.'') }} {{Question-answer | question = אלה | answer = ''eleh''
These, those }} {{Question-answer | question = שלו | answer = ''shelo''
His }} {{Question-answer | question = שלי | answer = ''sheli''
My }} | width=33% valign="top"| {{Question-answer | question = שלנו | answer = ''shelanu''
Our }} {{Question-answer | question = זאת | answer = ''zot''
This, that (''f'') }} {{Question-answer | question = רחובות | answer = ''reħovot''
Streets }} {{Question-answer | question = שלהן | answer = ''shelahen''
Their (''f'') }} {{Question-answer | question = בתים | answer = ''batim''
Houses }} {{Question-answer | question = שלה | answer = ''shelah''
Her }} | width=33% valign="top"| {{Question-answer | question = רחוב | answer = ''reħov''
Street }} {{Question-answer | question = שלהם | answer = ''shelahem'' }} {{Question-answer | question = זה | answer = ''zeh''
This, that (''m'') }} {{Question-answer | question = בית | answer = ''bayit''
House }} {{Question-answer | question = ערים | answer = ''‘arim''
Cities }} {{Question-answer | question = שלכן | answer = ''shelakhen''
Your (''f pl.'') }} |} ==Summary== In this lesson, you have learned: * How to demonstrate something ({{Hebrew|זֶה בַּיִת}}). * How to say something belongs to someone ({{Hebrew|העִיר שֶׁלִי}}). * How to substitute the verb “to be” ({{Hebrew|תל אביב היא עִיר}}). Practice what you've learned in the [[Hebrew/Exercises/Basic 6|exercises]]. ---- [[Hebrew/Basic/7|Next lesson: Basic 7 >>>]] [[Category:Hebrew]]
See [[w:User:piksi|my user page]] at Wikipedia.
{{anon}}

[[Wikibooks:Welcome|Welcome]] to Wikibooks, Capnbobo!
{| cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="margin:0em 0em 1em 0em; width:100%" | style="width:55%; vertical-align:top; border:1px solid #fad67d; background-color:#faf6ed;" |
[[Image:Crystal Clear app korganizer.png|20px]] '''First steps tutorial'''
'''Wikibooks is for freely-licensed collaboratively-developed [[WB:WIW|textbooks]].'''
You don't need technical skills in order to contribute here. '''[[WB:BOLD|Be bold]]''' contributing here and ''[[WB:AGF|assume good faith]]'' for the intentions of others. Remember, this is a ''[[w:wiki|wiki]]'', so you're allowed to change just about anything, and changes can be made easily. Come [[WB:HELP|introduce yourself]] to everyone, and let us know what interests you.
[[Image:Icon apps query.svg|20px]] '''Getting help'''
* Remember, every edit is saved, so if you make mistakes, you can [[Help:How to revert a page to an earlier version|revert]] to an earlier version if needed. * Get help from the community in the [[Wikibooks:Reading room|Reading room]] or in our [[irc:wikibooks|IRC channel]]. * We tag pages with various [[WB:TM|message templates]], such as {{tlx|query}}, to let editors know what needs to be improved. To learn more about these, ask at [[WB:PROJECTS|the projects reading room]]. * You cannot upload an image until you have been a member for at least '''4 days'''. If your upload is tagged with {{tlx|nld}}, {{tlx|bfu}}, or {{tlx|nfur}}, please read the template message as it explains the violation of [[WB:MEDIA|our media policy]]. Please be sure to provide the required {{tlx|information}}: a [[WB:ICT|license tag]] and source citation are always required; fair use images require a {{tlx|fair use rationale}}. Get help in the [[WB:HELP|user assistance room]]. | style="padding:0em 0.5em 0em 0.5em;" | | style="width:45%; vertical-align:top; border:1px solid #abd5f5; background-color:#f1f5fc;" |
[[Image:Transmission icon.png|20px]] '''Goodies, tips and tricks'''
* Please [[:w:Wikipedia:Sign your posts on talk pages|sign your name]] on discussion pages by typing ~~~~ * If you're coming here from Wikipedia, you should read [[WB:WFW|our primer for Wikipedians]] to get up-to-speed quickly. * '''Please make sure you follow our [[WB:NP|naming policy]]''' - modules should be named like Book Title/Chapter Title. * User scripts can make many tasks easier. Look at the ''Gadgets'' tab of [[Special:Preferences|''my preferences'']]; check off the boxes for the scripts you want, and hit ''save''!
[[Image:Nuvola filesystems trashcan full.png|20px]] '''Made a mistake?'''
* Need to rename a page? Use the ''move'' tab (only become available once your account is 4 days old - until then, ask for [[WB:HELP|help]]). * To get a page deleted, add {{tlx|delete|''your reason for requesting deletion''}} to the top of the page. * If something you wrote was deleted, please read the [[WB:DP|deletion policy]], and check the [[Special:Log/delete|deletion log]] to find out why. Also check the [[WB:VFD|VFD]] archives if applicable. You can request undeletion at [[WB:VFU]], or ask the administrator who deleted the page.
|- |align=right colspan=3|(P.S. Would you like to provide [[Template talk:Bigwelcome|feedback]] on this message?) |}

==Basic Numbers== #aan - 1<sup>st</sup> ærste #tweȝn - 2<sup>þe</sup> tweȝnþe #þrie - 3<sup>de</sup> þridde #fier - 4<sup>þe</sup> vierþe #feif - 5<sup>te</sup> feifte #six - 6<sup>te</sup> sixte #sefen -7<sup>þe</sup> sefenþe #aht -8<sup>þe</sup> ahtþe #niȝn -9<sup>þe</sup> niȝnþe #tien - 10<sup>þe</sup> tienþe #endlefen - 11<sup>te</sup> endlefte #twelf - 12<sup>te</sup> twelfte #þrietien - 13<sup>þe</sup> þrietienþe #fiertien - 14<sup>þe</sup> fiertienþe #feiftien #sixtien #sefentien #eahttien #niȝntien #tweȝtiȝ - 20<sup>þe</sup> tweȝtiȝþe #aanandtweȝtiȝ - 21<sup>þe</sup> aanandtweȝtiȝþe *þrittiȝ *fiertiȝ *feiftiȝ *sixtiȝ *sefentiȝ *eahtiȝ *niȝntiȝ - 90<sup>þe</sup> niȝntiȝþe *hund/hundred - the long form is for even hundreds; the short form is in compounded numbers. *endlefentiȝ - 110<sup>þe</sup> endlefentiȝþe *twelftiȝ - 120<sup>þe</sup> twelftiȝþe *twa hund *þusend *Million
==Writing Numbers== Numbers in Niw englisc are written together, as in modern German. For example: *256 = twahundsixandfeiftiȝ
The exception here is when writing basic numbers, such as two hundred, in which case the numbers are most often written separately: *200 = twa hundred *500 = feif hundred
==Fractions== Fractions are written using the ordinals with an ''-el'' suffix, as in German. *2/3 = tweȝn þriddel *8/13 = eaht þrietienþel

==Verbs== New Englisc verbs can be classified as ''weak'' or ''strong'' based on whether the vowel changes in the past tense or not. With its Anglo-Saxon origin, this notion is also present in English. flip, flipped, flipped sing, sang, sung Weak: wenden, wendte, gewendt Strong: drinken, drank, gedrunken ===Present Tense=== The present tense of verbs in Niw Englisc should be familiar to anyone who might have read Chaucer or Shakespeare. The older endings 'est' and 'eth' are present in Niw Englisc, much as they are in modern German (as 'st' and 't') {| | _ || sg. || pl. |- | Ic || drink'''e''' || drink'''eþ''' |- | þu || drink'''st''' || drink'''eþ''' |- | he/scie/it || drink'''þ''' || drink'''eþ''' |} This translates the modern English: I drink, I do drink, I am drinking. There is really no analogous construction to these forms in Niw Englisc. The closest is the ''am -oþ/-en'' construction: Ic em am Huntoþ - I'm hunting. Ic em am Surfen - I'm surfing. This is not too often used, as the simple verb gives the same meaning, but this form indicates that the activity has been going on for some time, and will continue to occur for at least some time into the future. ==Separable Verbs== Some prefixes can be separated from a verb, and when they do, must go to the end of the clause, like modern German. ===midkommen - to come along, come with=== {| | _ || sg. || pl. |- | Ic || komme mid || kommeþ mid |- | þu || kymmst mid || kommeþ mid |- | he/scie/it || kymmþ mid || kommeþ mid |} *Present Perfect: ic em ȝestern midgekommen *Subordinate Order: ic waat, þat ic ȝestern midgekommen em *Subordinate Modal Order: ic waat, þat ic ȝestern habe midkommen kunnen ==Modal Verbs== Modal verbs are those verbs that can take an infinitive as an object without a ''to'' beforehand. One example is "I can go" versus "I like to go" - can is a modal, while like is not. ===kunnen - can=== {| | _ || sg. || pl. |- | Ic || k'''a'''nn || k'''u'''nn'''eþ''' |- | þu || k'''a'''nn'''st''' || k'''u'''nn'''eþ''' |- | he/scie/it || k'''a'''nn || k'''u'''nn'''eþ''' |} This verb means 'can' in the sense that you can do something because you have the knowledge to do it. Alone, it can mean 'to know, be acquainted with' ===magen - can=== {| | _ || sg. || pl. |- | Ic || m'''a'''g || m'''a'''g'''eþ''' |- | þu || m'''a'''g'''st''' || m'''a'''g'''eþ''' |- | he/scie/it || m'''a'''g || m'''a'''g'''eþ''' |} This verb means 'can' in the sense that you can do something because you have the physical ability to do it. Alone, it can mean 'to be effective against' with the preposition 'wiþ.' ===moten - may=== {| | present || sg. || pl. |- | Ic || m'''o'''t || m'''o'''t'''eþ''' |- | þu || m'''o'''t'''st''' || m'''o'''t'''eþ''' |- | he/scie/it || m'''o'''t || m'''o'''t'''eþ''' |} {| | past || sg. || pl. |- | Ic || m'''o'''ste || m'''o'''st'''en''' |- | þu || m'''o'''ste'''st''' || m'''o'''st'''en''' |- | he/scie/it || m'''o'''ste || m'''o'''st'''en''' |} ===scullen - should=== {| | present || sg. || pl. |- | Ic || sc'''a'''ll || sc'''u'''ll'''eþ''' |- | þu || sc'''a'''ll'''st''' || sc'''u'''ll'''eþ''' |- | he/scie/it || sc'''a'''ll || sc'''u'''ll'''eþ''' |} {| | past || sg. || pl. |- | Ic || sc'''o'''lde || sc'''o'''ld'''en''' |- | þu || sc'''o'''lde'''st''' || sc'''o'''ld'''en''' |- | he/scie/it || sc'''o'''lde || sc'''o'''ld'''en''' |} *Definition: to owe ''with dative person owed, with accusative thing owed'' *Modal: ''denoting obligation or constraint of various kinds'' (meaning ''must, have to, ought, shall'') **''duty or moral obligation'', must, ought, have to **''being fit, right, proper, reasonable, logical'', shall, ought, have to **''obligation to perform an engagement, do work, carry out an agreement'' **''denoting bidding, commanding'', shall; ''hwat scall ic singan? - what shall I sing?'' **''obligation coming from law, statute, regulation'' **''decreed by fate or providence'', shall, must; ''he scall geblinded werðan - he must go blind''
''scall hine wulf etten - he shall be eaten by a wolf, i.e. a wolf must eat him'' **''with no alternative, or you can't help yourself'', must, be forced to; ''ic scall þen Keks etten - I have to eat the cookie!''
''ic scall Fotball scawen - I can't help but watch football, i.e. I must watch football'' **''because no alternative is admissable/possible, because a conclusion is inevitable'', to be obliged, must, shall; ''wiȝ sculleþ hin scyldiȝ finden - we must find him guilty'' **''denoting need, where the end is to be attained, a task to be completed, or purpose to be served'', shall, must; **''denoting certainty of future event, resulting from settled purpose or decision''; ''he wisste þat þie Burg scall abroken werðen - He (Christ) knew the city must be destroyed'' **''denoting certainty of result under proper conditions'', ''þu scallst mein Leif gebergen - you are certain to save my life'' **''probability'', ''weenst þu þat ic scall to þissem treowlæsen Mann sprekan? - do you think it likely that I shall speak to this false man?'' **''denoting an assertion not made by the speaker, a reported statement'', ''man scall þie Scol Mondæȝ open finden - it is said that one shall find the school open Monday'' **''with dropped infinitive'', ''ic scall þider - I must go there'', ''þie Gafel þe to Burg scall - the tax that must go to the city'' ===þurfen - need=== Present tense: {| | _ || sg. || pl. |- | Ic || þ'''a'''rf || þ'''u'''rf'''eþ''' |- | þu || þ'''a'''rf'''st''' || þ'''u'''rf'''eþ''' |- | he/scie/it || þ'''a'''rf || þ'''u'''rf'''eþ''' |} Ic '''þarf''' - I need to Þu '''þarfst''' - You need to He/Scie/It '''þarf''' - He/She/It needs to We '''þurfeþ''' - We need to Ȝe '''þurfeþ''' - You (plural) need to Hje '''þurfeþ''' - They need to '''Þarf ic anen Freond tom Fest bringen?''' Do I need to bring a friend to the party? Past tense: Ich '''þurfte''' Du '''þurftest''' He/Scie/It '''þurfte''' We '''þurften''' Ȝe '''þurften''' Hje '''þurften''' ===willen - want=== ==Irregular Verbs== [[Category:{{FULLBOOKNAME}}|{{FULLCHAPTERNAME}}]]

revision.text:
[[File:Map of USA NM.svg|thumb|200px|right|The location of New Mexico]] New Mexico is a U. S. State located in the southwestern region. It has been inhabited by American Indian populations and has been part of Mexico, and a U.S. territory. Among U.S. States, New Mexico has the highest percentage of Hispanics at 43%, made up of both recent immigrants and descendants of Spanish colonists. It also has the third-highest percentage of American Indians after Alaska and Oklahoma, and the fifth-highest total number of American Indians after [[Wikijunior:North America/United States/California|California]], [[Wikijunior:North America/United States/Oklahoma|Oklahoma]], [[Wikijunior:North America/United States/Arizona|Arizona]], and [[Wikijunior:North America/United States/Texas|Texas]]. The tribes represented in the state consist of mostly Navajo and Pueblo peoples. As a result, the demographics and culture of the state are unique for their strong Spanish, Mexican, and American Indian cultural influences. The climate of the state is highly arid and its territory is mostly covered by mountains and desert. [[File:Flag of New Mexico.svg|thumb|200px|right|The Flag of New Mexico]]
==History==
==Geography==
==People==
==State Symbols==
{{BookCat|filing=deep}}

[[File:Map of USA NY.svg|thumb|right|200px|The location of New York]] New York is a state in the Mid-Atlantic and Northeastern regions of the United States and is the nation's third most populous. The state is bordered by [[Wikijunior:North America/United States/New Jersey|New Jersey]] and [[Wikijunior:North America/United States/Pennsylvania|Pennsylvania]] to the south, and [[Wikijunior:North America/United States/Connecticut|Connecticut]], [[Wikijunior:North America/United States/Massachusetts|Massachusetts]] and [[Wikijunior:North America/United States/Vermont|Vermont]] to the east. The state has a maritime border with Rhode Island east of Long Island, as well as an international border with the Canadian provinces of Quebec and Ontario to the north. New York is often referred to as New York State to distinguish it from New York City. [[File:Flag of New York.svg|thumb|rihgt|200px|The Flag of New York]]
==History== New York was inhabited by different Native American groups at the time Dutch and French nationals moved into the region in the early 17th century. First claimed by Henry Hudson in 1609, the region came to have Dutch forts at Fort Orange, near the site of the present-day capital of Albany in 1614, and was colonized by the Dutch in 1624 at both Albany and Manhattan; it later fell to British rule in 1664.
New York state was one of the original thirteen colonies that became the United States. It was the 11th state to ratify the United States Constitution, on July 26, 1788.
==Geography== New York covers 54,556 square miles (141,299 km²) and ranks as the 27th largest state by size. New York's borders touch two Great Lakes: Erie and Ontario; the provinces of [[Wikijunior:North America/Canada/Ontario|Ontario]] and [[Wikijunior:North America/Canada/Quebec|Quebec]] in [[Wikijunior:North America/Canada|Canada]]; three New England states: [[Wikijunior:North America/United States/Vermont|Vermont]], [[Wikijunior:North America/United States/Massachusetts|Massachusetts]], and [[Wikijunior:North America/United States/Connecticut|Connecticut]]; the Atlantic Ocean, and two Mid-Atlantic states: [[Wikijunior:North America/United States/New Jersey|New Jersey]] and [[Wikijunior:North America/United States/Pennsylvania|Pennsylvania]].
==People== New York is the third largest state in population after [[Wikijunior:North America/United States/California|California]] and [[Wikijunior:North America/United States/Texas|Texas]], with an estimated population of 19,490,297 as of July 1, 2008.
Catholics make up more than 40% of the population in New York. Protestants are 30% of the population, Jews 8%, Muslims 4%, Buddhists 1%, and 13% claim no religious affiliation.
==State Symbols== *The State Bird is the [[w:Eastern Bluebird|Eastern Bluebird]] *The State Flower is the [[w:Rose|Rose]] *The State Insect is the [[w:Coccinellidae|9 Spotted Ladybug]] *The State Reptile is the [[w:Snapping Turtle|Snapping Turtle]] *The State Tree is the [[w:Sugar Maple|Sugar Maple]]
{{BookCat|filing=deep}}

[[File:Map of USA NC.svg|thumb|right|200px|The location of North Carolina]] North Carolina is a state located on the Atlantic Seaboard in the southeastern United States. The state borders [[Wikijunior:North America/United States/South Carolina|South Carolina]] and [[Wikijunior:North America/United States/Georgia|Georgia]] to the south, [[Wikijunior:North America/United States/Tennessee|Tennessee]] to the west and [[Wikijunior:North America/United States/Virginia|Virginia]] to the north. North Carolina's capital is Raleigh and the largest city is Charlotte. [[File:Flag of North Carolina.svg|thumb|right|200px|The Flag of North Carolina]]
==History== ==Geography== ==People== The state bird is the Cardinal and the state vegetable is the sweet potato.
==State Symbols==
{{BookCat|filing=deep}}

revision.text:
__NOTOC__
Anyone may contribute to this book. And you are encouraged to do so. Below are [[#Guidelines | guidelines]] we should all try to follow, and [[#Resources | resources]] useful for beginners to Wiki editing.
== Guidelines ==
Please try to follow these general guidelines:
# If adding to the FAQ, and it's a short answer, add it inline. Otherwise, create a separate sub-page. # If a FAQ answer is complex, consider whether some of it could be a "How-To" and reused for other purposes. # When creating sub-pages, please name them using the full path. This will ensure that the sub-page will be contained within this book's namespace, and you won't create a new "book." #* You can see how this should be done by editing an existing page which refers to a sub-page. #* To create a sub-page, just edit the parent page, create the link to the sub-page, save the parent page. Then, follow the link to sub-page. You will be presented a page to create it. # Please edit similar pages to get an idea what a new sub-page should contain. # Notice that the main "MagicJack" page contains special wiki tags that don't appear in sub-pages. # Don't be afraid to make changes. If you make a mistake, it can be undone. '''[[WB:BOLD | Be bold]]'''! # If you're unsure of a change you want to make, or if it's a large change, or something that might be controversial (or upset another contributor), please use the "Discussion" feature to talk about it and gain consensus. #* Likewise, if someone has made changes you disagree with, please use the "Discussion" feature for that page. Let's not have "[[Help:Glossary#edit war|edit wars]]." We know MagicJack generates heated passions among its users. There should be a way to represent everyone's point of view without a lot of drama. # If you use the "Discussion" feature, please sign your comments with these characters <nowiki>--~~~~</nowiki>. (This can be inserted using one of the icons available when editing text.). However, please do not sign actual contributions to pages. # If you have special interest in a page, please watch for changes and discussions by using the "Watch" feature at the top of that page. # For other questions, please contact [[User:Az2008|Az2008]] using the [[User_talk:Az2008 | discussion tab]] on that page, or email him [[Special:Emailuser/Az2008|here]]
== Resources ==
The following are useful for those new to wiki editing:
* [[Help:Contents|Wikibooks main help page]] * [[Wikibooks:Welcome|Welcome for newcomers]] * [[Wikibooks:Wikibooks_for_Wikimedians|Primer for Wikimedians]] * [[WB:RR|Reading room]]
The following are useful references for Wikibooks:
* [[Help:FAQ|FAQ]] * [[Help:Editing|Editing]] * [[Editing Wikitext]] * [[WB:UPLOAD|How to upload an image]]
The following are more esoteric topics:
* [[Help:Tracking changes#Page history|How to interpret page history]] * [[Help:Glossary|Glossary]] * [[Wikibooks:Manual_of_Style|Manual of Style]] * [[Help:Pages]] * [[Wikibooks:Naming_policy|Subpage convention - Naming policy]] * [[WB:MODULE|What is a module]]
The following Wikibooks policies may be useful:
* [[Wikibooks:Policies_and_guidelines|Policies and Guidelines]] * [[Wikibooks:Decision_making|Decision Making]] * [[Wikibooks:Neutral_point_of_view|Neutral Point of View]]
{{BookCat}}

__NOTOC__
[http://www.magicjack.com MagicJack] is a low-cost, consumer-grade Voice over IP (VOIP)<ref>See [[w:VOIP | VOIP]] at Wikipedia, [[Voice_over_IP | Voice over IP]] at Wikibooks.</ref> telephone service. The company is associated with [http://www.ymaxcorp.com YMAX Corp.]. Both were founded by [[w:Dan Borislow | Dan Borislow]].
MagicJack is unique the following ways compared to incumbent VOIP providers:
# Because MagicJack is related to YMAX, utilizes its network and YMAX is a true [[w:CLEC | CLEC]], MagicJack has a competitive advantage over other VOIP providers{{citation needed}}. This includes revenue generated by termination fees (paid by other providers for calls terminating at YMAX). But, the most visible advantage is seen in the [[MagicJack/Support_Resources/FAQ#How can I find available area codes and prefixes? | large number of area codes (and prefixes)]] available to MagicJack customers. # MagicJack's stated business model is to subsidize the cost of its service by collecting details about the numbers called by customers, and selling targeted advertising displayed by the softphone. (After one year there has been no advertising except special offers provided by MagicJack.). # MagicJack allows the use of a traditional ([[w:RJ-11 | RJ11]]) handset through a proprietary (supplied) USB device connected to the computer which acts as an [[w:Analog_telephony_adapter | ATA]]. # Extremely low price.<ref>See [[#Cost | Cost]]</ref> # The first VOIP provider to use mass-consumer advertising via [http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bsR3b2F9sUA infomercials].
== Features ==
MagicJack costs $1.67 per month (charged annually)<ref>See [[#Cost | Cost]].</ref> for relatively full-featured telephone service. Features include:
* A phone number in your choice of area code (and prefix). [[MagicJack/Support_Resources/FAQ#How can I find available area codes and prefixes? | Many area codes and prefixes]] are available. * Voice mail, always available regardless of whether the customer is using MagicJack at their computer. It will email a .wav file when a voice message is left. * Relatively unlimited long distance to the US, Canada and Puerto Rico.<ref>There appear to be limits. But, they aren't published and haven't been applied consistently. See [[MagicJack/Sentiment/Cons#excessive_use_oct2008 | Excessive use terminations]] and [[MagicJack/Sentiment/Cons#call_caps_dec2008 | Call caps]].</ref> * Call forwarding. * Call waiting. * Caller ID. * [[w:Enhanced_911 | Enhanced 911]] (E9-1-1) service. * Softphone used with a headset (connected to the computer's speaker/mic connectors). * The ability to use a traditional handset via the MagicJack USB device, independently of the softphone.
Be VERY wary of purchasing a MagicJack. They have one of the worst customer service records in the industry. Agents hang up on you if your questions aren't what they want to hear. They take advantage of every dollar they can make off you.
== Cost ==
MagicJack utilizes an annual subscription model. The first year costs $19.99 and is bundled with the required USB device which costs $20. (Total 39.99.). Additional years cost $19.99. It is possible to pre-purchase five additional years at a discount ($11.99 per year).
It is useful to compare VOIP services using a monthly price. However, converting MagicJack's annual price to a monthly rate is complicated by a few factors:
# VOIP services can end as quickly as they began.<ref>See [[w:SunRocket#Company shutdown | SunRocket]] ("On July 16, 2007, SunRocket ceased operations with no warning given to customers or employees.").</ref> # MagicJack doesn't give pro-rated refunds for unused time. # If the USB device fails, it may be necessary to purchase a new one. #* MagicJack's warranty of the device appears to be inconsistently applied. #* MagicJack doesn't sell the USB device separately, it is sold with one year of service regardless of whether you need it. # Discounted pre-purchased years which are $1.00 per month. Potentially driving up (or down) the savings.
Assuming the cost of the USB device, 1 year of service, and five additional years purchased at a discount, the following best- and worse-case scenarios can be theorized:
; Best case : In the best-case scenario (all goes well for six years): the cost is $1.39 per month.
; Worse case : In the worst-case scenario (it fails after 2 months): the cost is $49.97 per month.
For this reason, MagicJack users often refer to their purchase as a gamble (or investment). It has the potential to pay off if things go well. But, it should be remembered that it may not.
Using just one year of service (with the cost of USB device), and if it performs as expected for one year, the monthly price is $3.33.
Excluding the USB device (which could last multiple years), one year of service ($19.99) costs $1.67 per month.
<!-- This is a template to keep the heading out of the TOC --> {{hiddenh2|Notes}} <references/>
[[Category:{{FULLBOOKNAME}}|{{FULLCHAPTERNAME}}]]

__NOTOC__
MagicJack was widely sold while in "beta" status from mid-2007 to March 2008. It was popular among the internet "geek" crowd. Since then it has been considered "General Availability," and marketed to the average computer user via infomercials and brick-and-mortar retail stores.
== Generations ==
There are four known generations of the MagicJack USB device (also referred to as a [[w:Dongle | dongle]] or [[w:Analog_telephony_adapter | ATA]]). A FAQ article discusses [[MagicJack/Support Resources/FAQ#What's the difference in USB device (dongle) generations? | their differences and how to identify them]],Forth generation is the MagicJack PLUS it has an Ethernet port for stand alone operation.
== Packaging ==
There has been two types of packaging which were associated with the first two generations. However, it has been reported that the original plastic clam-shell packaging is being used for [http://www.dslreports.com/forum/r21628376- new generation devices in retail stores].
See these images of the various packaging:
* [http://www.dslreports.com/speak/slideshow/21608476?c=1381589&ret=L2ZvcnVtL3IyMTYwODQ3Ni1PbGQtbWFnaWNKYWNrLXZlcnNpb24tb24tZUJheQ%3D%3D Sealed in plastic shell]. Old style packaging, but reused for retail sales late 2008. * [http://www.dslreports.com/forum/r21647120- Another sealed plastic shell]. Found in retail stores. * [http://www.dslreports.com/forum/r21647120- Photos showing both old- and new-style]. * [http://www.dslreports.com/speak/slideshow/21608476?c=1381590&t=seti&ret=L2ZvcnVtL3IyMTYwODQ3Ni1PbGQtbWFnaWNKYWNrLXZlcnNpb24tb24tZUJheQ%3D%3D&dsz=o Packed in plastic foam within a cardboard sleeve]. Limited to online sales beginning Feb 2008. There have been some of these prior to Feb 2008, but they are rare. Therefore, it is not specific to any generation.
== MagicJack in the news ==
The following are important interviews with the MagicJack founder, possibly indicating the future direction of the service:
* [http://blog.laptopmag.com/magicjack-inventor-plans-linux-support-improved-customer-service-and-more MagicJack "Inventor Plans Linux Support, Improved Customer Service, and More,"] Laptop Mag., April 28, 2008 (Linux support, number porting, improved customer service.).
* [http://telephonyonline.com/voip/news/magicjack-attacks-0502/ "MagicJack Attacks,"] Telephony Online, May 2, 2008 ("Secret Sauce" and motivations.).
* [http://telephonyonline.com/residential_services/news/magic-jack-landline-replacement-0202/ "Making Sense of MagicJack's Math"] Telephony Online, Feb 2, 2009 (Speculation on MagicJack's contribution to incumbent landline subscriber loss, see founder's reader response to article, referring to imminent release of a "femtocell" product.).
[[Category:{{FULLBOOKNAME}}|{{FULLCHAPTERNAME}}]]

__NOTOC__
The following support resources are available for MagicJack users. You may find solutions to common problems in the [[/FAQ|FAQ]]. If not, [[/Requesting Help|help can be requested]].
[[/New users|New users]] should read the basic information which most new users struggle with.
* [[/New users|New User Issues]] * [[/FAQ|Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)]] * [[/How-To|How-To]] * [[/Requesting Help|Requesting Help]]
[[Category:{{FULLBOOKNAME}}|{{FULLCHAPTERNAME}}]]
